comments:
As well as a pop up dialog (that doesn't say much) here's the stack I see in the
error log.  I was able to reproduce this with a variety of XML files.  I think
we need to have the option to turn this off in the case where the validator is
performing slowly so users can disable background validation.

java.lang.NullPointerException
at
org.eclipse.wst.sse.ui.internal.reconcile.StructuredRegionProcessor.filterTotalScopeRegions(StructuredRegionProcessor.java:168)
at
org.eclipse.wst.sse.ui.internal.reconcile.StructuredRegionProcessor.process(StructuredRegionProcessor.java:123)
at
org.eclipse.wst.sse.ui.internal.reconcile.DirtyRegionProcessor.run(DirtyRegionProcessor.java:412)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)

Oops I should have mentioned the steps to reproduce more clearly...

1) uncheck 'Report problems as you type' in preferences
2) open an XML file in the XML Editor (or XML Schema editor)
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 103867 ***
Marking as verified just to signify correctly categorized.
